title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
3 Points

  • 1 - The MR curve below a downward sloping demand curve

  • 1- Quantity determined correctly (MR=MC)

  • 1 - Price determined correctly; read from the demand curve, up from the p-maximizing output
descriptions:
The student earns none of the following points:

  • 1 - The MR curve below a downward sloping demand curve

  • 1- Quantity determined correctly (MR=MC)

  • 1 - Price determined correctly; read from the demand curve, up from the p-maximizing outputt

The student earns one of the following points:

  • 1 - The MR curve below a downward sloping demand curve

  • 1- Quantity determined correctly (MR=MC)

  • 1 - Price determined correctly; read from the demand curve, up from the p-maximizing output

The student earns two of the following points:

  • 1 - The MR curve below a downward sloping demand curve

  • 1- Quantity determined correctly (MR=MC)

  • 1 - Price determined correctly; read from the demand curve, up from the p-maximizing output

The student earns all of the following points:

  • 1 - The MR curve below a downward sloping demand curve

  • 1- Quantity determined correctly (MR=MC)

  • 1 - Price determined correctly; read from the demand curve, up from the p-maximizing output

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
One point is earned for each correct condition below up to 2 points.

  • reduction in the barriers to entry

  • profits which were earned by the monopolists, and

  • returning property rights to original owners.
descriptions:
The student earns none of the following points:

One point is earned for each correct condition below up to 2 points.

  • reduction in the barriers to entry

  • profits which were earned by the monopolists, and

  • returning property rights to original owners.

The student earns one of the following points:

One point is earned for each correct condition below up to 2 points.

  • reduction in the barriers to entry

  • profits which were earned by the monopolists, and

  • returning property rights to original owners.

The student earns all of the following points:

One point is earned for each correct condition below up to 2 points.

  • reduction in the barriers to entry

  • profits which were earned by the monopolists, and

  • returning property rights to original owners.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
2 Points

  • 1 - Recognizing output is produced where MC=MR

  • 1 - Recognizing in some form that P=MR
descriptions:
The student earns none of the following points:

  • 1 - Recognizing output is produced where MC=MR

  • 1 - Recognizing in some form that P=MR

The student earns one of the following points:

  • 1 - Recognizing output is produced where MC=MR

  • 1 - Recognizing in some form that P=MR

The student earns all of the following points:

  • 1 - Recognizing output is produced where MC=MR

  • 1 - Recognizing in some form that P=MR

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
2 Points

  • 1 - Some correct definition of economic efficiency (P=MC or P=min ATC)

  • 1 - A comparison indicating that monopolist charges P>MC while the perfect competitor charges P=MC, or comparison indicating that monopolist does no necessarily produce at the minimum ATC while the perfect competitor must (in the long-run equilibrium).
descriptions:
The student earns none of the following points:

  • 1 - Some correct definition of economic efficiency (P=MC or P=min ATC)

  • 1 - A comparison indicating that monopolist charges P>MC while the perfect competitor charges P=MC, or comparison indicating that monopolist does no necessarily produce at the minimum ATC while the perfect competitor must (in the long-run equilibrium).

The student earns one of the following points:

  • 1 - Some correct definition of economic efficiency (P=MC or P=min ATC)

  • 1 - A comparison indicating that monopolist charges P>MC while the perfect competitor charges P=MC, or comparison indicating that monopolist does no necessarily produce at the minimum ATC while the perfect competitor must (in the long-run equilibrium).

The student earns all of the following points:

  • 1 - Some correct definition of economic efficiency (P=MC or P=min ATC)

  • 1 - A comparison indicating that monopolist charges P>MC while the perfect competitor charges P=MC, or comparison indicating that monopolist does no necessarily produce at the minimum ATC while the perfect competitor must (in the long-run equilibrium).
